definition: actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

sentences.english: He does exceedingly abundantly above and beyond what we could ever ask, imagine or think!

sentences.chinese: 以不失去应得之物为前提获得所想之物。

sentences.chinese: 那种安排同我原先所想的不同。

sentences.english: Tools are metaphors that shape how you think.

sentences.english: But the rate of pharmacy errors is much higher than people think.
sentences.chinese: 然而，药房的出错率比人们所想的要高得多。

sentences.english: Setting up role-based security is easier than most people think.
sentences.chinese: 设置基于角色的安全性比大部分人所想的更轻松。

sentences.english: However, many CMS are less flexible than their owners would like.
sentences.chinese: 然而，许多CMS没有它们主人所想的那般灵活。

sentences.english: What we believe brings us pleasure or pain!
sentences.chinese: 我们所想的会给我们带来快乐或痛苦。

sentences.english: May you live in interesting times, May you find what you are looking for.
